Subject: Re: [cantera] Some help on convergence problem?

Sean,

I have run equilibrium with your file and I see the same thing you do.   
It fails precisely at 10000 K. This can't be an accident, and yet I  
don't think there is any limit of 10000 K in the code.  i'll have to  
look into it and see what is going on.  I'll let you know when I find  
something.

Dave


On Dec 19, 2003, at 12:22 PM, hendersonsjh wrote:

> I'm having difficulties on using the "equilibrate" command to find
> the equilibrium compostion for the below air mixture for temps above
> 10,000 K.  I've used python, Matlab and MixMaster and always get the
> same error message of the program going over the maximum number of
> iterations of 1000.  I've tried altering the composition, pressure,
> number of species, ect and the equilibrate still gives an error
> message at exactly 10,000 K.  I find it hard to believe that the
> maximum number of iterations would occur at exactly 10,000 K for all
> cases.  If someone else could use the 'equilibrate' command with the
> below input file and see if they get the same error message it would
> be greatly appreciated.
>
> Thank You,
> Sean Henderson
>
> #
> #
> units(length = "m", time = "s", quantity = "mol", act_energy
> = "J/mol")
>
> ideal_gas(name = " high temperature air",
>       elements = " O  N E ",
>       species = """ E O2 N2 O N NO N2+ O2+ NO+ N+ O+ """,
>       reactions = "all",
>       transport = "none",
>       initial_state = state(temperature = 1000.0,
>                         pressure = OneAtm)    )
>
> #--------------------------------------------------------------------
> -----------
> #  Species data
> #--------------------------------------------------------------------
> -----------
>
> species(name = "E",
>     atoms = " E:1 ",
>     thermo = (
>        NASA( [ 1000.00,  6000.00], [ 2.5000e+000, -2.0227e-017,
> 9.5947e-021,
>                -1.7750e-024,  1.0847e-028, -7.4538e+002, -
> 1.1721e+001 ] ),
>        NASA( [ 6000.000, 20000.00], [ 2.5000e+000,  1.6025e-017, -
> 2.1524e-021,
>                1.3118e-025, -2.9635e-030, -7.4537e+002, -
> 1.1721e+001 ] )
>              )
>        )
>

>        NASA( [ 1000.00,  6000.000], [  3.8071e+000,  4.5694e-004, -
> 4.9851e-008,
>                3.4242e-012, -1.6188e-016, -1.2886e+003,
> 2.5652e+000 ] ),
>        NASA( [ 6000.000, 20000.00], [  4.0938e-001,  1.7796e-003, -

>                9.9210e-012, -1.6235e-016,  5.0869e+003,
> 2.6695e+001 ] )
